subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-20 09:42:54.000000000', 'files': ['ec2api/api/instance.py', 'ec2api/tests/unit/tools.py', 'ec2api/s3/s3server.py', 'ec2api/api/ec2utils.py', 'ec2api/exception.py', 'ec2api/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the
link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ib7ad61bac89e14561719434085b63cbad7e9a9be
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the
link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ib7ad61bac89e14561719434085b63cbad7e9a9be

commit_message:
monasca-agent: Fix systemd and tmpfile handling

The rundir needs to be created via tmpfiles because /run is mounted as tmpfs
sometimes.
Also the systemd macros were missing.

Change-Id: I5453d50cccd29a8ded03ea81633b624214ee8084

subject: Support file system based bank implementation
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-04-14 02:47:08.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/specs/file-system-bank.rst'], 'message': 'Support file system based bank implementation

Currently we only suppport Swift as a bank implementation. This means
that
anyone that uses Karbor must also install Swift. This might be
unacceptable or
over complicated for some deployments.

I suggest adding an FS based implementation. It will use files for
objects storing objects and object metadata.

Co-authored-by: chenying <ying.chen@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I2e63bd9148c1827862e10a7e37a21e67ce7988c9
Implements: blueprint file-system-bank

commit_message:
Support file system based bank implementation

Currently we only suppport Swift as a bank implementation. This means
that
anyone that uses Karbor must also install Swift. This might be
unacceptable or
over complicated for some deployments.

I suggest adding an FS based implementation. It will use files for
objects storing objects and object metadata.

Co-authored-by: chenying <ying.chen@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I2e63bd9148c1827862e10a7e37a21e67ce7988c9
Implements: blueprint file-system-bank

subject: N->O Manual puppet commands have the right modulepath.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 16515, 'name': 'mbu', 'email': 'mat.bultel@gmail.com', 'username': 'matbu'}, {'_account_id': 18851, 'name': 'Marius Cornea', 'email': 'mcornea@redhat.com', 'username': 'mcornea'}, {'_account_id': 20775, 'name': 'Carlos Camacho', 'email': 'ccamacho@redhat.com', 'username': 'ccamacho'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-04-20 11:20:09.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/run_puppet.sh', 'puppet/services/nova-api.yaml'], 'message': "N->O Manual puppet commands have the right modulepath.

In two places during upgrade we manually trigger puppet.

There can be a problem when new puppet modules are added, and their
corresponding symlinks in /etc/puppet/modules are not created during
the installation as their are installed in
/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules.  To prevent the issue tripleo set
modulepath in the templates.

We must use the same modulepath to make sure that we don't fail
because of missing module in the manual puppet run.

This particulary happens when you upgrade from M->N->O, as the base
image in Mitaka doesn't have the proper symlinks and they are not
created during the installation of the package.

Closes-Bug: #1684587

Change-Id: I79df6ea33f1c58e13309176a6de41b7572541fd6
"}]
commit_message:
N->O Manual puppet commands have the right modulepath.

In two places during upgrade we manually trigger puppet.

There can be a problem when new puppet modules are added, and their
corresponding symlinks in /etc/puppet/modules are not created during
the installation as their are installed in
/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules.  To prevent the issue tripleo set
modulepath in the templates.

We must use the same modulepath to make sure that we don't fail
because of missing module in the manual puppet run.

This particulary happens when you upgrade from M->N->O, as the base
image in Mitaka doesn't have the proper symlinks and they are not
created during the installation of the package.

Closes-Bug: #1684587

Change-Id: I79df6ea33f1c58e13309176a6de41b7572541fd6

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-19 19:02:59.000000000', 'files': ['test-install-neutron.yml', 'test-setup-swifthosts.yml'], 'message': "Add become to plays that delegate to localhost

'ansible_become' defined as a host_var or in the inventory for a host
has a higher precedence than 'become' defined within a playbook.

In change Id5b76a87809f03951c954fc3d752419a673403f7, 'become' was

Change-Id: Ifb5e907594ca5fba459ee5a90b202e17db081f9a
"}]
commit_message:
Add become to plays that delegate to localhost

'ansible_become' defined as a host_var or in the inventory for a host
has a higher precedence than 'become' defined within a playbook.

In change Id5b76a87809f03951c954fc3d752419a673403f7, 'become' was
defined explicitly for each play running against localhost. It will also
need to be defined in plays that delegate to localhost.

Change-Id: Ifb5e907594ca5fba459ee5a90b202e17db081f9a

commit_message:
run_tests.sh: Use sudo to install packages with pip

We need to use 'sudo' when installing packages with pip since we don't
use the --user option otherwise the script will fail if executed as a
non-root user.

Change-Id: I6572825f66fc2a5fb040ab165395b2c385a327b7

commit_message:
Add missing cleanup step for heat images

The heat images got apache as part of blueprint
apache-packages-for-apis without a cleaning up. Without this step the
containers may fail to restart due to runtime files already present.

Change-Id: I55a7144caa913117f71100f757b1e601de6471a6
Closes-Bug: #1679565

subject: Use checksum option when downloading RabbitMQ
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-11 07:50:24.000000000', 'files': ['meta/main.yml', 'tasks/rabbitmq_pre_install.yml'], 'message': "Use checksum option when downloading RabbitMQ

The 'sha256sum' option for the get_url module has been deprecated and
replaced with 'checksum'. The download is skipped if an existing file
already has the expected checksum, making the task to remove an existing
RabbitMQ package file unnecessary.

Change-Id: Icd41e6a316f319bbdfae303592f0f8fde919a312
"}]
commit_message:
Use checksum option when downloading RabbitMQ

The 'sha256sum' option for the get_url module has been deprecated and
replaced with 'checksum'. The download is skipped if an existing file
already has the expected checksum, making the task to remove an existing
RabbitMQ package file unnecessary.

Change-Id: Icd41e6a316f319bbdfae303592f0f8fde919a312

subject: Allow permissive access to non_root_user files
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 5792, 'name': 'Dan Radez', 'email': 'dradez@redhat.com', 'username': 'dradez'}, {'_account_id': 6994, 'name': 'Michael Chapman', 'email': 'woppin@gmail.com', 'username': 'michaeltchapman'}, {'_account_id': 8367, 'name': 'Arx Cruz', 'email': 'arxcruz@redhat.com', 'username': 'arxcruz'}, {'_account_id': 10022, 'name': 'Gabriele Cerami', 'email': 'gcerami@redhat.com', 'username': 'panda'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11491, 'name': 'Gael Chamoulaud', 'email': 'gchamoul@redhat.com', 'username': 'gchamoul'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}, {'_account_id': 17280, 'name': 'Tim Rozet', 'email': 'trozet@redhat.com', 'username': 'trozet'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20971, 'name': 'Feng Pan', 'email': 'fpan@redhat.com', 'username': 'fpan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2017-04-03 14:09:43.000000000', 'files': ['roles/common/defaults/main.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Allow permissive access to non_root_user files

Openvswitch ports cannot be connected to unprivileged libvirt
guests, so the only way to use OVS on the undercloud host at
the moment is to run the guests with privileges.

In this case, the root user is used to launch the VMs, and the
new option added in this patch can be used to give access to
the image files owned by the non_root_user.

Change-Id: Ife7f10df3d89798d3c5753f5ddc9a06eda5ef8d9
'}]
commit_message:
Allow permissive access to non_root_user files

Openvswitch ports cannot be connected to unprivileged libvirt
guests, so the only way to use OVS on the undercloud host at
the moment is to run the guests with privileges.

In this case, the root user is used to launch the VMs, and the
new option added in this patch can be used to give access to
the image files owned by the non_root_user.

Change-Id: Ife7f10df3d89798d3c5753f5ddc9a06eda5ef8d9

subject: Optimise apt cache update task
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-20 14:13:37.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/memcached_install.yml', 'meta/main.yml'], 'message': "Optimise apt cache update task

In https://review.openstack.org/457391 we consolidated
the package install tasks into one set, but it's also
possible to provide the package action plugin the
parameters for the underlying module, so we do that
here to get rid of the apt cache update task.

The minimum Ansible version is raised to 2.2 due to a
known bug [1] in Ansible's apt module which does not
update the cache properly if the cache update and the
install are combined in a single task.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/1497

Change-Id: If3209379c04b3bfdf3fd8af8615fc6e0036b1c52
"}]
commit_message:
Optimise apt cache update task

In https://review.openstack.org/457391 we consolidated
the package install tasks into one set, but it's also
possible to provide the package action plugin the
parameters for the underlying module, so we do that
here to get rid of the apt cache update task.

The minimum Ansible version is raised to 2.2 due to a
known bug [1] in Ansible's apt module which does not
update the cache properly if the cache update and the
install are combined in a single task.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/1497

Change-Id: If3209379c04b3bfdf3fd8af8615fc6e0036b1c52

subject: Add regression test for server filtering by tags bug 1682693
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-17 19:19:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/integrated_helpers.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api/client.py', 'nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1682693.py'], 'message': "Add regression test for server filtering by tags bug 1682693

There was a latent bug in the DB API code such that when we
process filters when listing instances, the various tags
filters have their values popped out of the filters dict and
the values (which are lists) for the filter also have the
first item in the list popped out to build the query.

This latent bug was exposed in Newton when we started listing
instances in the API from both cell0 and the main cell database,
because the query to cell0 would pop an item and then it
would not be in the 2nd query to the main cell database. If we
only had one tag in the filter list, we get an IndexError on
the 2nd pop() call.

Note that we also use the build_requests table in the API to
list instances, but there would not be any tagged servers in
that table since a server has to be ACTIVE before you can tag it,
and build_requests only exist until the instance is put into a
cell and starts building there (so it won't be ACTIVE yet).

Change-Id: I65bdfadd406368775c794ee4d8a16302a8a134bc
Related-Bug: #1682693
(cherry picked from commit 01dd1a05a213c0cbd0097188418cabe915291c8d)
"}]
commit_message:
Add regression test for server filtering by tags bug 1682693

There was a latent bug in the DB API code such that when we
process filters when listing instances, the various tags
filters have their values popped out of the filters dict and
the values (which are lists) for the filter also have the
first item in the list popped out to build the query.

This latent bug was exposed in Newton when we started listing
instances in the API from both cell0 and the main cell database,
because the query to cell0 would pop an item and then it
would not be in the 2nd query to the main cell database. If we
only had one tag in the filter list, we get an IndexError on
the 2nd pop() call.

Note that we also use the build_requests table in the API to
list instances, but there would not be any tagged servers in
that table since a server has to be ACTIVE before you can tag it,
and build_requests only exist until the instance is put into a
cell and starts building there (so it won't be ACTIVE yet).

Change-Id: I65bdfadd406368775c794ee4d8a16302a8a134bc
Related-Bug: #1682693
(cherry picked from commit 01dd1a05a213c0cbd0097188418cabe915291c8d)

subject: Mock timeout in test__get_node_console_with_reset_wait_timeout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-19 16:35:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Mock timeout in test__get_node_console_with_reset_wait_timeout

This test is failing intermittently because it's waiting for a real
timeout from BackOffLoopingCall which does an exponential backoff
each interval. Sometimes the test times out entirely and fails.

This changes the test to mock BackOffLoopingCall and raise the timeout
exception to simulate a timeout. The only thing not covered by this is
calling of the _wait_state() function, but that is covered by other
unit tests in the file.

Closes-Bug: #1683953

Change-Id: Ie3ff6b0020dca8a5f5292b327aa2491920e338ef
"}]
commit_message:
Mock timeout in test__get_node_console_with_reset_wait_timeout

This test is failing intermittently because it's waiting for a real
timeout from BackOffLoopingCall which does an exponential backoff
each interval. Sometimes the test times out entirely and fails.

This changes the test to mock BackOffLoopingCall and raise the timeout
exception to simulate a timeout. The only thing not covered by this is
calling of the _wait_state() function, but that is covered by other
unit tests in the file.

Closes-Bug: #1683953

Change-Id: Ie3ff6b0020dca8a5f5292b327aa2491920e338ef

subject: Split validation at 3 layers
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-04-19 17:11:39.000000000', 'files': ['rally/cli/cliutils.py', 'rally/task/engine.py', 'rally/task/validation.py', 'tests/unit/common/test_validation.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/context/keystone/users.py', 'tests/unit/doc/test_task_samples.py', 'tests/unit/rally_jobs/test_jobs.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_engine.py', 'rally/common/validation.py'], 'message': 'Split validation at 3 layers

We can group validation by 3 types: syntax (check that config is valid
for plugin in terms of jsonschema, required arguments, etc),
platform (check that deployment has credentials for launching
the plugin on specific environment), semantic(all others which operates
users: for example validate that specific service is enabled).

Splitting validation by these groups is required to support "validators
for validators". I mean that if we check that syntax of config is valid
and that we have credentials for all required platforms, we able to
execute more complex validators and ensure that they will not failed on
"random" failures like "AttributeError", "KeyError" and etc.

Change-Id: I1ea38403af6cfbd6b7765ae3c0caca12759bc571
'}]
commit_message:
Split validation at 3 layers

We can group validation by 3 types: syntax (check that config is valid
for plugin in terms of jsonschema, required arguments, etc),
platform (check that deployment has credentials for launching
the plugin on specific environment), semantic(all others which operates
users: for example validate that specific service is enabled).

Splitting validation by these groups is required to support "validators
for validators". I mean that if we check that syntax of config is valid
and that we have credentials for all required platforms, we able to
execute more complex validators and ensure that they will not failed on
"random" failures like "AttributeError", "KeyError" and etc.

Change-Id: I1ea38403af6cfbd6b7765ae3c0caca12759bc571

commit_message:
Remove image_format config section

If the reference to the external-ceph-guide file configuration,
glance only supports raw image format.
I test can work normally of qcow2 image.
If enable ceph in kolla,the config section is not config.
see:
https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/glance/templates/glance-api.conf.j2

subject: Vagrantfile: Do not run the tox tests as root
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-20 10:02:39.000000000', 'files': ['Vagrantfile'], 'message': "Vagrantfile: Do not run the tox tests as root

By default, Vagrant runs the provision script as root. However, in the
OpenStack CI such tests are being executed as normal user so we observe
different behaviors when we compare the tests results between these two
platforms. As such, add 'privileged: false' to the Vagrantfile to
make Vagrant provision the VM as normal user.

Closes-Bug: 1682108
Change-Id: Ia4887d90d77110a88030a1958f57eddce5c4b2c2
"}]
commit_message:
Vagrantfile: Do not run the tox tests as root

By default, Vagrant runs the provision script as root. However, in the
OpenStack CI such tests are being executed as normal user so we observe
different behaviors when we compare the tests results between these two
platforms. As such, add 'privileged: false' to the Vagrantfile to
make Vagrant provision the VM as normal user.

Closes-Bug: 1682108
Change-Id: Ia4887d90d77110a88030a1958f57eddce5c4b2c2

commit_message:
Move wsgi-intercept to test-requirements.txt

The wsgi-intercept dependency is only used in the functional
tests for the placement API, so we should move it to the
test-requirements.txt file so people don't try to package
it for runtime installs.

Change-Id: I0d8325e12ed7d5d022877782d6aa4ba4055c30db
Closes-Bug: #1625653

subject: Ports not unplugged following unbind
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-20 09:53:15.000000000', 'files': ['networking_generic_switch/tests/unit/test_generic_switch_mech.py', 'networking_generic_switch/generic_switch_mech.py'], 'message': "Ports not unplugged following unbind

When using the networking genericswitch ML2 driver with ironic, neutron
ports on a tenant network are not unplugged after they have been
unbound. This means that the corresponding port remains an untagged
member of the tenant network VLAN on the switch.

This was seen on a Dell/Force10 S6010-ON switch. These switches have
slightly different CLI semantics than Cisco switches, which makes the
plug/unplug operation non-idempotent. The non-idempotent nature of the
operation means that a port that is an access port on one VLAN cannot be
made an access port on another VLAN using the 'plug' command alone - the
'unplug' command is required as well. This means that without manual
intervention, port configuration becomes a 'one shot' activity.

The NGS driver currently unplugs ports from VLANs only when ports are
deleted. However, since (at least) Ocata, ironic unbinds[0] ports before
they are deleted. This means that they lose their port binding
information during an update operation, and therefore do not have the
information required to unplug the port on the switch during the delete
operation.

The solution to this is to add support for unplugging ports following an
unbind operation. This change adds that support to the
update_port_postcommit method of the NGS mechanism driver.

[0]
https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/19ced862a782f204048ca2cb7f4904d75a6d7925/ironic/drivers/modules/network/neutron.py#L199

Change-Id: Ie4ea148793f9a754fae415c2661c6f2add6a97c8
Closes-Bug: #1683687
"}]
commit_message:
Ports not unplugged following unbind

When using the networking genericswitch ML2 driver with ironic, neutron
ports on a tenant network are not unplugged after they have been
unbound. This means that the corresponding port remains an untagged
member of the tenant network VLAN on the switch.

This was seen on a Dell/Force10 S6010-ON switch. These switches have
slightly different CLI semantics than Cisco switches, which makes the
plug/unplug operation non-idempotent. The non-idempotent nature of the
operation means that a port that is an access port on one VLAN cannot be
made an access port on another VLAN using the 'plug' command alone - the
'unplug' command is required as well. This means that without manual
intervention, port configuration becomes a 'one shot' activity.

The NGS driver currently unplugs ports from VLANs only when ports are
deleted. However, since (at least) Ocata, ironic unbinds[0] ports before
they are deleted. This means that they lose their port binding
information during an update operation, and therefore do not have the
information required to unplug the port on the switch during the delete
operation.

The solution to this is to add support for unplugging ports following an
unbind operation. This change adds that support to the
update_port_postcommit method of the NGS mechanism driver.

[0]
https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/19ced862a782f204048ca2cb7f4904d75a6d7925/ironic/drivers/modules/network/neutron.py#L199

Change-Id: Ie4ea148793f9a754fae415c2661c6f2add6a97c8
Closes-Bug: #1683687

commit_message:
tests: remove oslo.config fixture usage

Now that prepare_service() is used to get a transient conf object, there's no
need for a fixture since the object is never reused.

Change-Id: I7b43c6d10cfa11525dc6d10e150f931d045259dc

add caching the GetParametersAction

15s to 3s

Added tests for plan.UpdatePlanAction as there were none there.

commit_message:
Fix old terminology

publicURL is a keystonev2 hold over. It's now just "public" and
endpoint_type is also old, it is now known as "interface".

Since this is new work, there is no need to perpetuate the old forms.

Change-Id: I7608ab0fa33c6dd815d9907020469df621c73885

commit_message:
Split out openstack-cinder task

openstack-cinder task has been splitted out to avoid race condition
when syncdb ain't completed (or even not started yet) on primary
controller before a cinder-api service start up on secondary ones.

Change-Id: Ic506ba6f5b5908a71eca52a077d8bd6084655dc6
Closes-Bug: #1681686

subject: grafana: disable for non-x86
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-19 09:18:46.000000000', 'files': ['docker/grafana/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'grafana: disable for non-x86

Kolla depends on upstream version of Grafana and those are provided only
for x86-64 architecture.

On other archs package from distribution can be fetched but build then
fail due to version differences.

And it does not look like there will be newer version in distributions:

https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=835210

Partially-Implements: blueprint multiarch-and-arm64-containers

Change-Id: I62911fd3cabdc25c23e93d621ebe2464f8e4fb6e
'}]
commit_message:
grafana: disable for non-x86

Kolla depends on upstream version of Grafana and those are provided only
for x86-64 architecture.

On other archs package from distribution can be fetched but build then
fail due to version differences.

And it does not look like there will be newer version in distributions:

https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=835210

Partially-Implements: blueprint multiarch-and-arm64-containers

Change-Id: I62911fd3cabdc25c23e93d621ebe2464f8e4fb6e

subject: Containerize clustercheck galera monitor for HA deployments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-20 12:38:07.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/pacemaker/clustercheck.yaml'], 'message': 'Containerize clustercheck galera monitor for HA deployments

In HA overcloud deployments, HAProxy makes use of a helper service called
"clustercheck", to check whether galera nodes are available for serving
traffic.

This change implements a dedicated service for clustercheck, which was
originally part of the pacemaker mysql service.  The service is
configured by tripleo and the container's lifecycle is managed by docker,
like other containerized services.

Change-Id: I3bdc1ae0af5a570126cd3b0ec3de41c705cc7940
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Depends-on: I1aabe34fa6a9c8c705a4405f275b66502c313cf2
'}]
commit_message:
Containerize clustercheck galera monitor for HA deployments

In HA overcloud deployments, HAProxy makes use of a helper service called
"clustercheck", to check whether galera nodes are available for serving
traffic.

This change implements a dedicated service for clustercheck, which was
originally part of the pacemaker mysql service.  The service is
configured by tripleo and the container's lifecycle is managed by docker,
like other containerized services.

Change-Id: I3bdc1ae0af5a570126cd3b0ec3de41c705cc7940
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Depends-on: I1aabe34fa6a9c8c705a4405f275b66502c313cf2

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-10 20:27:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_create_backup.py', 'api-ref/source/servers-admin-action.inc', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Document and provide useful error message for volume-backed backup

The createBackup API does not support backing up volume-backed
instances. The error message the user gets is not useful about
why the request was invalid, and the API reference docs do not
mention the limitation. This change addresses both of those issues.

Change-Id: I04fd8ab4f8818d9d0ccccb6f6fcb34965b15b8f3
Partial-Bug: #1679314
'}]
commit_message:
Document and provide useful error message for volume-backed backup

The createBackup API does not support backing up volume-backed
instances. The error message the user gets is not useful about
why the request was invalid, and the API reference docs do not
mention the limitation. This change addresses both of those issues.

Change-Id: I04fd8ab4f8818d9d0ccccb6f6fcb34965b15b8f3
Partial-Bug: #1679314

commit_message:
Use wsgi module from oslo.service

Basic WSGI functionality has been moved to oslo.service [1].
Now it can be used in karbor project.
This patch also is prepared for supporting karbor api deployment
with wsgi mod.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.service/blob/master/oslo_service/wsgi.py

commit_message:
Use LABEL instead of MAINTAINER (deprecated) in all Dockerfile.j2

Use LABEL instruction instead of MAINTAINER (deprecated) instruc-
tion as suggested by Docker's official dockerfile guide.
docs.docker.com/engine/reference/builder/#maintainer-deprecated

Closes-Bug: #1683652

Change-Id: Ie87a1ddf31aefcd0b623fd2837d78de420e76898

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix initialising of LVM ephemeral disks

The LVM backend expects to write directly to the target disk rather
than to the image cache when initialising an ephemeral disk. This is
confounded by Image.cache(), which doesn't call the given callback
(_create_ephemeral in this case), if the target already exists.

Closes-Bug: #1648109
Co-authored-by: Feodor Tersin <ftersin@hotmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic9178d6c013670611e63d54a7669f35dc9770e91
(cherry picked from commit de5bb0c3fe9e86166e81aa2465a8e7791f64ba39)

commit_message:
libvirt: workaround findmnt behaviour change

findmnt as provided by util-linux-2.23.2-33 now returns 0 when --source
is already mounted on the host under a different mountpoint [1]. This causes
issues in environments where cinder-volume may have already mounted a
given NFS share.

This change works around this behaviour change by using os.path.ismount
to confirm if the target is already a mountpoint and if a source is
provided also checking /proc/mounts to confirm that it is mounted at the
target location.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1405238

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/volume/test_nfs.py
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/volume/test_smbfs.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Test conflicts caused by the removal of mox in Ocata by
I1b56a63d6044602b0af1a71bc97c3ac6d7cef05f and the passing of only the
host to the volume drivers by I87ceeee1ec46dc22754321574b16e6c47b27a848.

Closes-Bug: #1656774
Change-Id: Id64cc77237bf770a9a75bbf666a54a604ace558c
(cherry picked from commit 86b361d9166200db2174be87214190a29e77f98f)

commit_message:
block pbr 2.1.0

it seems to be broken[1] and the libraries we use blacklist it
causing VersionConflicts as it behaves like upper cap since no
newer versions exists.

[1] I3612e27853e8c62f4933369e2f405ddff13ed8ea

Change-Id: I32124bcceef4391d1a367be5ed8bdbc1d40e2f24

subject: Add RouterExtraAttributes when create router
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-20 02:23:16.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/unit/test_l3_router_plugin.py', 'dragonflow/neutron/services/l3_router_plugin.py'], 'message': "Add RouterExtraAttributes when create router

Since l3_attrs_db.ExtraAttributesMixin is not in dragonflow's l3
router plugin's inherit tree. So, all the router created by
dragonflow will not have RouterExtraAttributes value in neutron db.

RouterExtraAttributes will be used in neutron db query, missing
it will make some functionality not work, e.g. BGP query.

Change-Id: Ice68fa959b8d49bec529a8287c8367939f22a92b
Closes-Bug: #1681223
"}]
commit_message:
Add RouterExtraAttributes when create router

Since l3_attrs_db.ExtraAttributesMixin is not in dragonflow's l3
router plugin's inherit tree. So, all the router created by
dragonflow will not have RouterExtraAttributes value in neutron db.

RouterExtraAttributes will be used in neutron db query, missing
it will make some functionality not work, e.g. BGP query.

Change-Id: Ice68fa959b8d49bec529a8287c8367939f22a92b
Closes-Bug: #1681223

commit_message:
debian: move to stretch

Debian 'jessie' even with backports lacks some packages Kolla expects. Due
to this we (Linaro) move to Debian 'stretch' release with our OpenStack
work.

Stretch is now frozen so there should not be many changes.

Partially-Implements: blueprint multiarch-and-arm64-containers

Change-Id: Iab7232cbe6f8fc3e3de10c67f3d89f134b185f05

commit_message:
Clarification for suspend in the Glossary

Suspend is defined as a synonim as pause, however it is not true
as in case of suspend the VM state is saved to disk.

Signed-off-by: csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-04-18 15:49:16.000000000', 'files': ['validations/lookup_plugins/tht.py', 'releasenotes/notes/tht-lookup-111fb8a9748e9fa7.yaml', 'scripts/tripleo-ansible-inventory', 'tripleo_validations/utils.py'], 'message': 'Add lookup plugin for tripleo heat templates

This patch adds a lookup plugin for tripleo heat templates
that playbooks can use as: "{{ lookup('tht') }}"

The lookup will return a list of tuples, each tuple
containing the path and the contents of the file.

To implement this the auth token as well as the plan
name have been added to the inventory.

Change-Id: I8ab1563dc887e51339e669592011f2115cfe5e4c
'}]
commit_message:
Add lookup plugin for tripleo heat templates

This patch adds a lookup plugin for tripleo heat templates
that playbooks can use as: "{{ lookup('tht') }}"

The lookup will return a list of tuples, each tuple
containing the path and the contents of the file.

To implement this the auth token as well as the plan
name have been added to the inventory.

Change-Id: I8ab1563dc887e51339e669592011f2115cfe5e4c

commit_message:
Fix Tripleo upgrade tests by increasing timeout

It's currently hard to impossible to get anything merged if these tests
are voting (for example on the stable/ocata branch); please see the
related bugs. The original reason is not yet known, so this should be
temporary to get the gate passing again until the primary reason is
solved.

Related-Bug: 1684272
Related-Bug: 1680259

Change-Id: I6a470caccf88d7c3fff6e52d2a9b227e548d607d

subject: networkutils: specializes the exception raised by _get_vnic_settings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-20 10:24:43.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/tests/unit/utils/network/test_networkutils.py', 'os_win/utils/network/networkutils.py', 'os_win/exceptions.py'], 'message': 'networkutils: specializes the exception raised by _get_vnic_settings

VMs can be destroyed before their vNICs had a chance to be bound.
When trying to bind a vNIC of an already-destroyed VM, os-win will
raise a HyperVException.

This patch specializes the exception raised in this case, allowing
consumers to treat this case differently.

Change-Id: I8fabe8799d0e57dcc5627d67b3962c4f11f08f1e
Closes-Bug: #1684045
'}]
commit_message:
networkutils: specializes the exception raised by _get_vnic_settings

VMs can be destroyed before their vNICs had a chance to be bound.
When trying to bind a vNIC of an already-destroyed VM, os-win will
raise a HyperVException.

This patch specializes the exception raised in this case, allowing
consumers to treat this case differently.

Change-Id: I8fabe8799d0e57dcc5627d67b3962c4f11f08f1e
Closes-Bug: #1684045

commit_message:
api-ref: Fix response code and parameters in evacuate

* Unnecessary note is removed.

* The 'on_shared_storage' parameter
  The max version is 2.13.
  Improve the description.

* The 'evacuate' parameter
  Fix the type and the description.

* The 'adminPass' parameter
  Fix the description and remove max version.

* The 'host' parameter
  Improve the description.

* response code
  Remove unncessary response codes.
  Add a missing response code.

Change-Id: Ic857333ac25bee26e3ec22106b1b8fda2389b967
Implements: blueprint api-ref-in-rst-pike
Closes-Bug: #1683264

commit_message:
Create the neutron-sanity-check validations

It runs the neutron-sanity-check tool on the undercloud and controller
nodes.

There need to be two validations since they run on different nodes and
at different stages of the deployment. In addition, their input config
files may end up being different although they're identical for now.

Change-Id: I8353753eb57faf6edd3b9c6ff9ef0f404dae5b56

commit_message:
Avoid running multiple etcd process

If both Zun and Kuryr-libnetwork are enabled in devstack, the script
might fail since etcd will be installed and started twice. This commit
fixed it.

subject: Add nova-network functional job for openstackclient
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-19 08:04:52.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/osc.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add nova-network functional job for openstackclient

We decide to support nova-network related commands in
python-openstackclient for stable openstack deployments,
sadly nova team mark nova-network as deprecated feature and
remove the support in novaclient 8.0.0. We rework to talk with
nova API directly bypass novaclient, now we need a job to verify
the changes, enable both n-net and n-cell, because n-net only can
be used in nova cell v1, and this is a non-voting job, because
some features are missing in cell v1, like: security group.

Change-Id: If4ef17b16f2fcf4698c035402b894ea660eaf976
'}]
commit_message:
Add nova-network functional job for openstackclient

We decide to support nova-network related commands in
python-openstackclient for stable openstack deployments,
sadly nova team mark nova-network as deprecated feature and
remove the support in novaclient 8.0.0. We rework to talk with
nova API directly bypass novaclient, now we need a job to verify
the changes, enable both n-net and n-cell, because n-net only can
be used in nova cell v1, and this is a non-voting job, because
some features are missing in cell v1, like: security group.

Change-Id: If4ef17b16f2fcf4698c035402b894ea660eaf976

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-13 01:49:18.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/neutron.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add neutron job with ryu master

ryu is often released(basically every month). And the new release
may affect the behavior of ovs agent. This adds job to check neutron
with the ryu master to avoid a trouble with the new ryu release.

It is added as an experimental job firstly and if it is stable
we make it a periodic job.

Change-Id: I82f404a04a1082140208546fad28ca369d210d5a

commit_message:
Add neutron job with ryu master

ryu is often released(basically every month). And the new release
may affect the behavior of ovs agent. This adds job to check neutron
with the ryu master to avoid a trouble with the new ryu release.

It is added as an experimental job firstly and if it is stable
we make it a periodic job.

Change-Id: I82f404a04a1082140208546fad28ca369d210d5a

commit_message:
Add cursive and castellan to PROJECTS

In order to use cursive and castellan from git instead of pip,
it is necessary to add them to the PROJECTS variable.

This is needed in order to fix the errors seen for the following:
http://logs.openstack.org/03/455903/1/experimental/gate-barbican-simple-crypto-dsvm-tempest-castellan-from-git-ubuntu-xenial-nv/7346952/logs/devstack-early.txt.gz#_2017-04-19_18_44_56_320
http://logs.openstack.org/02/357202/9/check/gate-barbican-simple-crypto-dsvm-tempest-cursive-ubuntu-xenial-nv/6cf8057/logs/devstack-early.txt.gz#_2017-04-19_18_38_49_282

Change-Id: I1ba6b6dc0acafb11e598958b0a4adcd8d9f81a4f

commit_message:
Add openstack/training-guides gerritbot for upstream-institute

Much of the work that we are doing in the
openstack-upstream-institute channel is making changes to
our slides in openstack/training-guides/doc/upstream-training .
It would be helpful to get notifications when patches are pushed
up and merged.

This patch adds that functionality to our channel.

Change-Id: I5bd19cd12b67460ebb64a5c426d69098b484baa5

Automatically enable the proxy headers parsing middleware so Glance
can detect X-Forwarded-Proto when SSL is terminated at the load
balancer.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-20 08:18:40.000000000', 'files': ['docker/ironic/ironic-pxe/extend_start.sh', 'docker/freezer/freezer-api/extend_start.sh', 'docker/nova/nova-api/extend_start.sh', 'docker/cinder/cinder-api/extend_start.sh', 'docker/keystone/keystone/extend_start.sh'], 'message': 'Add missing cleanup step for new apache images

A few new images got apache as part of blueprint
apache-packages-for-apis without a cleaning up. Without this step the
containers may fail to restart due to runtime files already present.

This commit fixes it for all images with the exception of heat-base so
that it can be cleanly backported to stable/ocata.

It also removes the unused APACHE_DIR variable from freezer-api and
keystone extend_start.sh script.

Change-Id: I47d75221b3d1aae91f11d3e0da83e221a00315b7
Closes-Bug: #1679565
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing cleanup step for new apache images

A few new images got apache as part of blueprint
apache-packages-for-apis without a cleaning up. Without this step the
containers may fail to restart due to runtime files already present.

This commit fixes it for all images with the exception of heat-base so
that it can be cleanly backported to stable/ocata.

It also removes the unused APACHE_DIR variable from freezer-api and
keystone extend_start.sh script.

Change-Id: I47d75221b3d1aae91f11d3e0da83e221a00315b7
Closes-Bug: #1679565

commit_message:
TLS-everywhere: Enable for TLS libvirt live migration

This relies on using the default paths for certs/keys used by libvirt
and is only enabled if TLS-everywhere is enabled.

bp tls-via-certmonger

commit_message:
Add default password modification in devstack

Password in providers' configuration files will never be
modified when doing installation with devstack.This will
make the default swift provider not work properly when
we change the default password in local.conf.

Change-Id: Ic5636e9f87aac2cc177941cd27178a8d200ca8fa
Closes-Bug: #1651110

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2017-04-18 06:00:09.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/cephfs/driver.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/cephfs/test_driver.py', 'manila/share/manager.py', 'doc/source/devref/index.rst', 'doc/source/devref/cephfs_driver.rst', 'manila/opts.py', 'doc/source/devref/share_back_ends_feature_support_mapping.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/rename-cephfs-native-driver-3d9b4e3c6c78ee98.yaml'], 'message': "Refactor and rename CephFSNativeDriver

Refactor CephFSNativeDriver as a driver class using protocol helper
classes. The helper classes would handle protocol specific driver
actions such as controlling access and fetching share's export
locations. For now, the driver uses a protocol helper to support
CephFS's native protocol. The driver can be made to support other
NAS protocols later on by adding protocol helper classes.

Since the driver would not just support the native protocol
rename the driver's file name and its driver class as
`driver` and `CephFSDriver` respectively. The driver would by
default support the native protocol, and can be referred to
by its previous class name and module name.

DocImpact

Partially-impelements: blueprint cephfs-nfs-support

Change-Id: I8a33be1df4864131435b794e791cc2d651fbe741
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor and rename CephFSNativeDriver

Refactor CephFSNativeDriver as a driver class using protocol helper
classes. The helper classes would handle protocol specific driver
actions such as controlling access and fetching share's export
locations. For now, the driver uses a protocol helper to support
CephFS's native protocol. The driver can be made to support other
NAS protocols later on by adding protocol helper classes.

Since the driver would not just support the native protocol
rename the driver's file name and its driver class as
`driver` and `CephFSDriver` respectively. The driver would by
default support the native protocol, and can be referred to
by its previous class name and module name.

DocImpact

Partially-impelements: blueprint cephfs-nfs-support

Change-Id: I8a33be1df4864131435b794e791cc2d651fbe741

commit_message:
Update tox envlist

Django 1.7 is not supported for a few releases and
can be easily removed from test env. Also, Django 1.10
unit tests are included to envlist to help make them
voting tests.

Change-Id: I6407180888fabd223e0393ef9e24de5a3558c25b

subject: Ensure tests run in isolation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-18 11:48:42.000000000', 'files': ['kolla/tests/test_build.py'], 'message': 'Ensure tests run in isolation

Previously, the images were copied locally in the tests as an attempt
to ensure test isolation but the parent image was still pointing to the
global object. This commit updates the images to point to the local
copies.

Rename the images to have more descriptive names and fix an issue in
test_skip_parents where the regex parameter was passed as a string
while it should be an array, that appeared once the images had their
correct parents.

Also bypass docker client memoization to further minimize the risk of
breaking test isolation.

Change-Id: Id7df645284f260cd615188db2efe889c9cf8115d
Closes-Bug: #1683314
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure tests run in isolation

Previously, the images were copied locally in the tests as an attempt
to ensure test isolation but the parent image was still pointing to the
global object. This commit updates the images to point to the local
copies.

Rename the images to have more descriptive names and fix an issue in
test_skip_parents where the regex parameter was passed as a string
while it should be an array, that appeared once the images had their
correct parents.

Also bypass docker client memoization to further minimize the risk of
breaking test isolation.

Change-Id: Id7df645284f260cd615188db2efe889c9cf8115d
Closes-Bug: #1683314

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-20 07:46:19.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Fixup event transaction semantics for ML2 bulk ops

This splits out code in ML2 for ports, subnets, and networks
into clear before, during, and after functions corresponding
to the state of the transaction they are called within.
This allows the bulk creation to correctly call chunks of code
outside of DB transactions even when doing many creations at once.

Change-Id: Id6fe0f5066358be954a6ca14dd49c36755897e31
Closes-Bug: #1683550
'}]
commit_message:
Fixup event transaction semantics for ML2 bulk ops

This splits out code in ML2 for ports, subnets, and networks
into clear before, during, and after functions corresponding
to the state of the transaction they are called within.
This allows the bulk creation to correctly call chunks of code
outside of DB transactions even when doing many creations at once.

Change-Id: Id6fe0f5066358be954a6ca14dd49c36755897e31
Closes-Bug: #1683550

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-20 04:37:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Fix doc generation for Python3

Fix the Sphinx html_last_updated_fmt for Python3.
The html_last_updated_fmt option is interpeted as a

commit_message:
Fix doc generation for Python3

Fix the Sphinx html_last_updated_fmt for Python3.
The html_last_updated_fmt option is interpeted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: Ife5b7762c8ebce005f2a3a3b59f8c01eca48c55d

subject: Make openrc deployment file work with keystone v3
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-04-20 07:08:33.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/cli/commands/test_deployment.py', 'rally/cli/commands/deployment.py', 'tests/ci/rally_gate_functions.sh'], 'message': 'Make openrc deployment file work with keystone v3

When using a deployment with keystone v3 the env variable
OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=3 is not written to ~/.rally/openrc.
This causes requests by the openstack cli to fail unless the user sets
that variable manually.
This patch fixes this issue by writing OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION to the
openrc file when using a deployment.

Closes-Bug: #1683820

Change-Id: I591eeacdd96e71d13561a7edade297223da86f73
'}]
commit_message:
Make openrc deployment file work with keystone v3

When using a deployment with keystone v3 the env variable
OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=3 is not written to ~/.rally/openrc.
This causes requests by the openstack cli to fail unless the user sets
that variable manually.
This patch fixes this issue by writing OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION to the
openrc file when using a deployment.

Closes-Bug: #1683820

Change-Id: I591eeacdd96e71d13561a7edade297223da86f73

subject: Fix Freezer service config override issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-13 13:22:30.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/freezer/tasks/config.yml'], 'message': "Fix Freezer service config override issue

Freezer service configuration can't be override has describe here:
https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/doc/advanced-configuration.rst#L161

Kolla-ansible should look for files in /etc/kolla/config/ but it doesn't
take config files into account. This patch fix it.

Change-Id: Ia7d8d0892d13ba9785951a7b1291abb868fc714b
Closes-Bug: #1682404
(cherry picked from commit a6a76a7b74958b87f2fac308c1c7b1b4f168361b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Freezer service config override issue

Freezer service configuration can't be override has describe here:
https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/doc/advanced-configuration.rst#L161

Kolla-ansible should look for files in /etc/kolla/config/ but it doesn't
take config files into account. This patch fix it.

Change-Id: Ia7d8d0892d13ba9785951a7b1291abb868fc714b
Closes-Bug: #1682404
(cherry picked from commit a6a76a7b74958b87f2fac308c1c7b1b4f168361b)

commit_message:
Mount /lib/modules folder for cinder-volume container

When using cinder lvm backend storage driver, lvcreate will load dm_*
linux modules when need. So /lib/modules is needed by cinder_volume
container.

Change-Id: I80985794d6aaa6b4ddc71680a97e0d07085dafa7
Closes-Bug: #1684378

subject: N->O upgrade, fix wrong parameters to nova placement.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-19 12:30:56.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/major_upgrade_steps.j2.yaml'], 'message': 'N->O upgrade, fix wrong parameters to nova placement.

According to [1] we need os_region_name, not region_name.  Furthermore
the os_interface is configured as well.  The hard check on this
parameter was introduced in ocata[2], explaining why the newton version
did not chock on it.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/config-reference/compute/config-options.html
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/d486315e0

Closes-Bug: #1684058
Change-Id: If6118bf03e832fe3fa5ea4fcb1b436afd2adf80a
'}]
commit_message:
N->O upgrade, fix wrong parameters to nova placement.

According to [1] we need os_region_name, not region_name.  Furthermore
the os_interface is configured as well.  The hard check on this
parameter was introduced in ocata[2], explaining why the newton version
did not chock on it.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/config-reference/compute/config-options.html
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/d486315e0

Closes-Bug: #1684058
Change-Id: If6118bf03e832fe3fa5ea4fcb1b436afd2adf80a

commit_message:
ConntrackNetlink driver to delete conntrack entries

This patch proposes ConntrackNetlink driver to delete conntrack
entries.
Using Netlink will save about 90 percent of time that used by conntrack-tools.
For detail information, visit: https://goo.gl/3tm9Fx

Partial-Bug: #1664294
Change-Id: Id9a3b7c3f8fedbd91ced1a5b359dbf568cd26653
Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Phuong An <AnNP@vn.fujitsu.com>

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 13:58:28.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Specifies gabbi version in test-requirements.txt

Because of the modification of the handlers module in gabbi 1.26,
the python2.7 gate jobs did not work properly. This patch specifies that
the gabbi version must be inferior to 1.26.

Change-Id: I69f93959f30a829d746da24a17c10c8f75d60d6a
Closes-Bug: 1628930
(cherry picked from commit 302bb438f8d75dbc9d779a8e8df47d58b7fdb7ba)
'}]
commit_message:
Specifies gabbi version in test-requirements.txt

Because of the modification of the handlers module in gabbi 1.26,
the python2.7 gate jobs did not work properly. This patch specifies that
the gabbi version must be inferior to 1.26.

Change-Id: I69f93959f30a829d746da24a17c10c8f75d60d6a
Closes-Bug: 1628930
(cherry picked from commit 302bb438f8d75dbc9d779a8e8df47d58b7fdb7ba)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-07 04:56:48.000000000', 'files': ['container-images/overcloud_containers.yaml', 'container-images/tripleo_kolla_template_overrides.j2', 'contrib/overcloud_containers.yaml', 'setup.cfg', 'contrib/tripleo_kolla_template_overrides.j2'], 'message': 'Rename contrib to container-images for packaging

A contrib directory would not be considered packagable, but we have an
increasing need to package overcloud_containers.yaml and
tripleo_kolla_template_overrides.j2 for image building and pulling in
CI and other environments.

This change renames contrib to container-images and adds symlinks in
contrib so that scripts[1] and documentation[2] that depend on this
location can be moved over to using packaged container-images rather
than git contrib.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/tree/roles/overcloud-prep-containers/templates/overcloud-prep-containers.sh.j2#n33
    https://github.com/dprince/undercloud_containers/blob/master/build_kolla.sh#L47

[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-docs/tree/doc/source/containers_deployment/tips_tricks.rst#n167
    http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-docs/tree/doc/source/containers_deployment/architecture.rst#n52
    http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-docs/tree/doc/source/containers_deployment/overcloud.rst#n58

Change-Id: Ifb736fb52e255260a4f1931b0b9b27206f2f1d82
'}]
commit_message:
Rename contrib to container-images for packaging

A contrib directory would not be considered packagable, but we have an
increasing need to package overcloud_containers.yaml and
tripleo_kolla_template_overrides.j2 for image building and pulling in
CI and other environments.

This change renames contrib to container-images and adds symlinks in
contrib so that scripts[1] and documentation[2] that depend on this
location can be moved over to using packaged container-images rather
than git contrib.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/tree/roles/overcloud-prep-containers/templates/overcloud-prep-containers.sh.j2#n33
    https://github.com/dprince/undercloud_containers/blob/master/build_kolla.sh#L47

[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-docs/tree/doc/source/containers_deployment/tips_tricks.rst#n167
    http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-docs/tree/doc/source/containers_deployment/architecture.rst#n52
    http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-docs/tree/doc/source/containers_deployment/overcloud.rst#n58

Change-Id: Ifb736fb52e255260a4f1931b0b9b27206f2f1d82

subject: Wait for the policy to be done in tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-10 21:45:59.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/functional/test_heat_autoscaling.py', 'heat_integrationtests/scenario/test_autoscaling_lb.py', 'heat_integrationtests/common/test.py', 'heat_integrationtests/scenario/test_autoscaling_lbv2.py'], 'message': 'Wait for the policy to be done in tests

As observed in the amqp job, we sometimes signal scale policy too fast,
without waiting for the medata to be set. It creates a timeout. We can
check the metadata of the policy before signaling again, to make sure
that we can move forward.

Change-Id: I9857803ef960efbd034f05985ec8fcc7272e2f70
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for the policy to be done in tests

As observed in the amqp job, we sometimes signal scale policy too fast,
without waiting for the medata to be set. It creates a timeout. We can
check the metadata of the policy before signaling again, to make sure
that we can move forward.

Change-Id: I9857803ef960efbd034f05985ec8fcc7272e2f70

commit_message:
Fix calls to call_until_true

Some tests use call_until_true, but don't check the returned value. If
False, the check isn't actually correct.

Change-Id: I6625a2e57d1d1c1ac03647786c210a9b57490562

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-13 19:39:12.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/compute-role.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/pluggable-server-type-per-role-314f38f8e5d4c84e.yaml', 'overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.j2.yaml', 'puppet/cephstorage-role.yaml', 'puppet/objectstorage-role.yaml', 'puppet/role.role.j2.yaml', 'puppet/blockstorage-role.yaml', 'puppet/controller-role.yaml'], 'message': 'Pluggable server type per Role

The server resource type, OS::TripleO::Server can now be mapped per role
instead of globally. This allows users to mix baremetal
(OS::Nova::Server) and deployed-server (OS::Heat::DeployedServer) server
resources in the same deployment.

blueprint pluggable-server-type-per-role

Change-Id: Ib9e9abe2ba5103db221f0b485c46704b1e260dbf
'}]
commit_message:
Pluggable server type per Role

The server resource type, OS::TripleO::Server can now be mapped per role
instead of globally. This allows users to mix baremetal
(OS::Nova::Server) and deployed-server (OS::Heat::DeployedServer) server
resources in the same deployment.

blueprint pluggable-server-type-per-role

Change-Id: Ib9e9abe2ba5103db221f0b485c46704b1e260dbf

commit_message:
Haproxy: When using TLS everywhere, use verifyhost for the balancermembers

This checks that the subjectAltName in the backend server's certificate
matches the server's name that was intended to be used.

Change-Id: If1c61e1becf9cc84c9b18835aef1eaaa8c0d4341

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-10 15:45:54.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/remotefs.py'], 'message': "RemoteFS: fix volume cascade delete

Attempting to delete a volume along with its snapshots fails for
RemoteFS based drivers. The reason is that that the driver expects
the volume status to be 'available', 'in-use' or 'backing-up',
while in this situation the volume status would be 'deleting'.

Most of those drivers apply locks to the volume/snapshot deletion
methods, so it should be safe to just add 'deleting' to the list of
acceptable volume states for this operation.

Change-Id: I1242d03fb6bbbd40ac2dace1aa865a6f91c22d23
Closes-Bug: #1681406
"}]
commit_message:
RemoteFS: fix volume cascade delete

Attempting to delete a volume along with its snapshots fails for
RemoteFS based drivers. The reason is that that the driver expects
the volume status to be 'available', 'in-use' or 'backing-up',
while in this situation the volume status would be 'deleting'.

Most of those drivers apply locks to the volume/snapshot deletion
methods, so it should be safe to just add 'deleting' to the list of
acceptable volume states for this operation.

Change-Id: I1242d03fb6bbbd40ac2dace1aa865a6f91c22d23
Closes-Bug: #1681406

commit_message:
Make the Result class more convienient to use

Action was added to mistral_lib.actions to make it simpler to use.
However, generally you also need the Result class. This adds it in the
same place, so actions developers only need to import one module to
access both classes.

Change-Id: I51ae3440ac62ebad5ae13a5e3edf01df66af71c7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-24 12:57:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_os_vif_util.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py', 'nova/network/os_vif_util.py'], 'message': 'WIP: libvirt: Always enable firewall

The (now deprecated) 'firewall_driver' config option was intended to
determine which firewall driver was used by the nova-network network
driver. However, it has also been co-opted (or corrupted) for use when
using the neutron network driver with the libvirt virt driver. When
using the libvirt driver, neutron dynamically tells us whether it wants
firewalling of ports or not. By configuring nova to use the "noop"
firewall driver, you can disable firewalling regardless of neutron's
wishes. This firewall-no firewall decision can and should be made at the
network driver side, meaning, seeing as nova-network is going away, that
neutron should be the only one making this decision. Correct this
loophole by removing checks for the "noop" firewall driver, ensuring
that the firewall can only be disabled at the neutron side.

Change-Id: I3da4439a9a0ec9445f19190003618323013df151
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: libvirt: Always enable firewall

The (now deprecated) 'firewall_driver' config option was intended to
determine which firewall driver was used by the nova-network network
driver. However, it has also been co-opted (or corrupted) for use when
using the neutron network driver with the libvirt virt driver. When
using the libvirt driver, neutron dynamically tells us whether it wants
firewalling of ports or not. By configuring nova to use the "noop"
firewall driver, you can disable firewalling regardless of neutron's
wishes. This firewall-no firewall decision can and should be made at the
network driver side, meaning, seeing as nova-network is going away, that
neutron should be the only one making this decision. Correct this
loophole by removing checks for the "noop" firewall driver, ensuring
that the firewall can only be disabled at the neutron side.

Change-Id: I3da4439a9a0ec9445f19190003618323013df151

commit_message:
Improve help for periodic message_reap_interval

The help text that went with the message_reap_interval
wasn't clear and didn't include the time unit that was
being used.  This patch improves the wording and indicates the
value is seconds.

Change-Id: Idbcd2c2d516adc361fd8a102b9b38afaefcff40b

commit_message:
Correct the group name field less than or equal to 64 characters

If create or update group name longer than 64 characters, api will return
'Recoverable error: Group name should not be greater than 64 characters.
(HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-979dfe60-c461-4fdc-ab6c-61c62ed24ff3)'.

Change-Id: I95a668c5bf24a58930e4d881417b8f732148bc93
Closes-Bug: #1684353

commit_message:
Inspection: fail fast if inspector returns error

Getting server error, like `node not found in cache` on inspection
status check is ignored, and ironic continues to wait for inspection
results for nothing.

Change-Id: I1467a1153106885790dbb71185fda5acc637ef53

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-20 07:59:29.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/repositories.txt'], 'message': 'Fix the last known good rdo trunk delorean repo

We currently point to https://buildlogs.centos.org/centos/7/cloud/x86_64/rdo-trunk-master-tripleo/delorean.repo
in our docs. There is currently an infrastructure problem when syncing
there and using that repo will give the user a 403:
https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/af/f5/aff5d8f30d73cf34e9a52a0b070143f128e37e79_57e4b623/python2-ceilometerclient-2.8.0-0.20170206121840.658d7e2.el7.centos.noarch.rpm:

According to Javier we need to use the following repo:
https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/current-passed-ci/delorean.repo

Change-Id: Ie2b20ea13fdb9d15ce6d4a4c17cfb573b85ac764
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the last known good rdo trunk delorean repo

We currently point to https://buildlogs.centos.org/centos/7/cloud/x86_64/rdo-trunk-master-tripleo/delorean.repo
in our docs. There is currently an infrastructure problem when syncing
there and using that repo will give the user a 403:
https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/af/f5/aff5d8f30d73cf34e9a52a0b070143f128e37e79_57e4b623/python2-ceilometerclient-2.8.0-0.20170206121840.658d7e2.el7.centos.noarch.rpm:
[Errno 14] HTTPS Error 403

According to Javier we need to use the following repo:
https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/current-passed-ci/delorean.repo

Change-Id: Ie2b20ea13fdb9d15ce6d4a4c17cfb573b85ac764

commit_message:
Remove usage of deprecated get_ipv6_addr_by_EUI64 function

As properly decorated with oslo-debtcollector, the get_ipv6_addr_by_EUI64
function from the data_utils module is deprecated. We should use the
equivalent function from oslo-utils instead.

Change-Id: Ida84f13fff2b660af67676ed3432ffefe0b8f2bb

subject: Fix a message bug after live migrate failed
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-20 07:12:07.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/instances/forms.py'], 'message': 'Fix a message bug after live migrate failed

If live migrate operation failed, there would be a message like:
'Failed to live migrate instance to host "host01".'
But, if we choose none target host, the message will be:
'Failed to live migrate instance to host "".'
The empty quotes looks strange.

I think, change the message to 'Failed to live migrate instance.' will be better.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I56a119616ec1f7728495a4695c2bcbc836b436f7
Closes-Bug: #1684394
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a message bug after live migrate failed

If live migrate operation failed, there would be a message like:
'Failed to live migrate instance to host "host01".'
But, if we choose none target host, the message will be:
'Failed to live migrate instance to host "".'
The empty quotes looks strange.

I think, change the message to 'Failed to live migrate instance.' will be better.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I56a119616ec1f7728495a4695c2bcbc836b436f7
Closes-Bug: #1684394

subject: Improve operation of creating ports
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-04-18 13:12:07.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_local_plugin.py', 'tricircle/network/local_plugin.py'], 'message': "Improve operation of creating ports

1. What is the problem?
When creating a load balancer, the service plugin creates a port for the
load balancer, whose fixed_ips is filled with subnet_id. As a result, it
is processed as ip specified cases by mistake.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
To ensure the operation of creating port can be processed as ordinary
cases, extra judgement for load balancer's port is added.

3.  What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: If70ca6258d6c518c95e060691d2547d9bbf7359d
"}]
commit_message:
Improve operation of creating ports

1. What is the problem?
When creating a load balancer, the service plugin creates a port for the
load balancer, whose fixed_ips is filled with subnet_id. As a result, it
is processed as ip specified cases by mistake.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
To ensure the operation of creating port can be processed as ordinary
cases, extra judgement for load balancer's port is added.

3.  What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: If70ca6258d6c518c95e060691d2547d9bbf7359d

commit_message:
docs: Update TESTING.rst about openvswitch requirements

Since we switched to use Ubuntu Cloud Archives in upstream gate, the
note in TESTING.rst is not longer valid for the gate. The condition to
trigger the test still remains in order to avoid false negative test
results for those that run functional tests with older openvswitch
version.

Change-Id: Ibff983efe0f452864d003913205cbbfa39ee7374

commit_message:
Remove subunit-trace fork

This makes tox use the latest version of the tool from os-testr repo,
which contains some valuable changes, like the one making the gate fail
if for some reason no tests are executed because all of them are
skipped.

Change-Id: If88be4b310d746ccc885e3d0c1db8a4dfabb2a28

subject: Apply upper-constraints when building venvs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-08 06:50:54.000000000', 'files': ['leap-upgrades/lib/functions.sh'], 'message': "Apply upper-constraints when building venvs

When building a venv for leap upgrades, checkout the applicable
requirements repo SHA and apply its upper-constraints file. If
packages within the venv are installed unconstrained, a project's
database migration scripts may fail.

Also remove tempest from being built within the venv.

Change-Id: Ic7e9aaa2d445bfe22c0f707a00a867cc8e84a38d
"}]
commit_message:
Apply upper-constraints when building venvs

When building a venv for leap upgrades, checkout the applicable
requirements repo SHA and apply its upper-constraints file. If
packages within the venv are installed unconstrained, a project's
database migration scripts may fail.

Also remove tempest from being built within the venv.

Change-Id: Ic7e9aaa2d445bfe22c0f707a00a867cc8e84a38d

subject: Enable more inclusive cluster filtering when listing events
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-17 02:10:37.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_events.py'], 'message': "Enable more inclusive cluster filtering when listing events

This patch adds logic so that when listing events with cluster 'id' as
filters, users can actually specify the name, full-id or short-id of a
cluster. It will be more convenient for users.
If any of the specified cluster is not found from the database, we
return an empty list of events.

Closes-Bug: #1642869
Change-Id: Ic27053e6b90658f35b577038d26b4aebb9d4475f
"}]
commit_message:
Enable more inclusive cluster filtering when listing events

This patch adds logic so that when listing events with cluster 'id' as
filters, users can actually specify the name, full-id or short-id of a
cluster. It will be more convenient for users.
If any of the specified cluster is not found from the database, we
return an empty list of events.

Closes-Bug: #1642869
Change-Id: Ic27053e6b90658f35b577038d26b4aebb9d4475f

subject: Optimize batch policy for nodes usage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-18 06:17:53.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/policies/test_batch_policy.py', 'senlin/policies/batch_policy.py'], 'message': "Optimize batch policy for nodes usage

This patch optimizes the batch policy so that it doesn't use the
cluster's runtime data. It can actually run one DB query to retrieve
the list of nodes. The patch also reworks the invocation to batch size
computation and plan creation so that the logic is much clearer.

Change-Id: Iced73ced7a0195e105d9ce92ae2c81010cd2825d
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize batch policy for nodes usage

This patch optimizes the batch policy so that it doesn't use the
cluster's runtime data. It can actually run one DB query to retrieve
the list of nodes. The patch also reworks the invocation to batch size
computation and plan creation so that the logic is much clearer.

Change-Id: Iced73ced7a0195e105d9ce92ae2c81010cd2825d

subject: Still wait for hooks on failed resources
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-06 15:04:53.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Still wait for hooks on failed resources

Previously, if a resource was in a FAILED state Heat would set the hook
but not wait for the user to clear it before continuing. It is not clear
what case this was designed to handle, since there's no way that I know
of for the resource to go into a FAILED state while waiting for the
hook.

Change-Id: Iaacc585b9806c08fd5a57c80c10eeb31cb0a8f71
Closes-Bug: #1665699
(cherry picked from commit 5cd7ff3fa66779bb7db9bf36e55e95863bbfa0e9)
"}]
commit_message:
Still wait for hooks on failed resources

Previously, if a resource was in a FAILED state Heat would set the hook
but not wait for the user to clear it before continuing. It is not clear
what case this was designed to handle, since there's no way that I know
of for the resource to go into a FAILED state while waiting for the
hook.

Change-Id: Iaacc585b9806c08fd5a57c80c10eeb31cb0a8f71
Closes-Bug: #1665699
(cherry picked from commit 5cd7ff3fa66779bb7db9bf36e55e95863bbfa0e9)

subject: tox.ini: Set PYTHONPATH when executing tox tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-18 15:35:49.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'tox.ini: Set PYTHONPATH when executing tox tests

Ansible seems to override the default PYTHONPATH so set PYTHONPATH
explicitely to point to the virtualenv location so that ansible modules
can import the LXC module.

Link: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/executor/module_common.py#L154
Related-Bug: 1682108
Change-Id: Ia87fdc30e200bf81992d6cf1dc3f49c64e900c2d
'}]
commit_message:
tox.ini: Set PYTHONPATH when executing tox tests

Ansible seems to override the default PYTHONPATH so set PYTHONPATH
explicitely to point to the virtualenv location so that ansible modules
can import the LXC module.

Link: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/executor/module_common.py#L154
Related-Bug: 1682108
Change-Id: Ia87fdc30e200bf81992d6cf1dc3f49c64e900c2d

subject: Updates and bug fixes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-31 13:27:24.000000000', 'files': ['multi-node-aio-xenial-ansible/variables.sh', 'multi-node-aio-xenial-ansible/deploy-osa.sh', 'multi-node-aio-xenial-ansible/no-cobbler-configure-vms.sh', 'multi-node-aio-xenial-ansible/setup-pxeboot.sh', 'multi-node-aio-xenial-ansible/setup-host.sh'], 'message': 'Updates and bug fixes

Several minor issues/annoyances fixed

* Changed the http_proxy tests to [ ! -z ] rather than [ -n ]
* Added http_proxy tests to no-cobbler-configure-vms.sh
* Added additional packages that are missing when a trusty OnMetal
  is upgraded to Xenial
* The isc-dhcp-server and atftpd services were not coming up so I
  have added specific restarts for both services to ensure that they
  come up
* Updated variables.sh to respect user set overrides, defaults have
  not been altered

Change-Id: I23ee641c2b6a36b18f4486f62af569d1ad28d5dc
'}]
commit_message:
Updates and bug fixes

Several minor issues/annoyances fixed

* Changed the http_proxy tests to [ ! -z ] rather than [ -n ]
* Added http_proxy tests to no-cobbler-configure-vms.sh
* Added additional packages that are missing when a trusty OnMetal
  is upgraded to Xenial
* The isc-dhcp-server and atftpd services were not coming up so I
  have added specific restarts for both services to ensure that they
  come up
* Updated variables.sh to respect user set overrides, defaults have
  not been altered

Change-Id: I23ee641c2b6a36b18f4486f62af569d1ad28d5dc

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-04-19 22:20:47.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/docker.pp'], 'message': 'Ensure /etc/docker/daemon.json

A recent Centos docker packaging change removed the default
/etc/docker/daemon.json file. As such we need to create an empty
json file if none exists before running Augeas to configure
the settings.

Closes-bug: #1684297
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure /etc/docker/daemon.json

A recent Centos docker packaging change removed the default
/etc/docker/daemon.json file. As such we need to create an empty
json file if none exists before running Augeas to configure
the settings.

Change-Id: Ibfe04b468639002f55da7bb65d2606f730c700b7
Closes-bug: #1684297

commit_message:
Improve the qty digit in sqlalchemy storage

Improving the qty digit from Numeric(10,5) to Numeric(15,5).
Upgrading the storage sqlalchemy DB by the cloudkitty-storage-init command.
Closes-Bug: #1672685

Change-Id: If086520479703257a0453a0371a1bc184911a802

commit_message:
Filtering attachment doesn't support 'instance_id'

Use method 'pop' to replace 'instance_id' with 'instance_uuid'.

Change-Id: I8bcb31c3bdba98e0024d001024ca1504e9263608
Closes-Bug: #1683701

commit_message:

commit_message:
Use new enginefacade

It is used in neutron for ports since
8756cb7d990fcb5735292a8fdc601af3333eb86c, breaking a flow classifier
plugin test. Update code to use it too in networking-sfc

Also clean flow classifier plugin test code

Change-Id: Ibeeab6917572fbb3ed6b1718d45130230449f08f
Closes-Bug: #1683680
Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch

commit_message:
Disable Mistral

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454710 broke us and now we need
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/455425/ to fix it, chicken and egg.

So let's disable Mistral until we get a promotion in RDO and re-enable
it again so we can land https://review.openstack.org/#/c/455425/ and
revert this patch and test Mistral again.

Change-Id: Ia7bf048901abf1cb96fa27e56752f66eac92f885

commit_message:
Track free fs space with dstat

We don't keep track of how much disk we actually need when running
devstack (and its services). Add the --freespace flag to dstat to
capture this data too.

Change-Id: I36ed1ba27861723e451154d20c7b765595022138

subject: Test running stack.sh with systemd unit support
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-22 22:38:07.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'Test running stack.sh with systemd unit support

There is a bootstrapping problem in making sure the stack user is logged
in properly in order to run systemd user units. Ensure that
libpam-systemd is installed and that when we su to the user we do so as
an initial login. Need this to make sure XDG_RUNTIME_DIR is present and
configured.

Note that we use su because on ubuntu at least pam does not use regular
session setup when using sudo, even when you use sudo -i.

Depends-On: I836bf27c4cfdc449628aa7641fb96a5489d5d4e7
Change-Id: I077c358a05ba39bcea756baa3d20f5007827d82c
'}]
commit_message:
Test running stack.sh with systemd unit support

There is a bootstrapping problem in making sure the stack user is logged
in properly in order to run systemd user units. Ensure that
libpam-systemd is installed and that when we su to the user we do so as
an initial login. Need this to make sure XDG_RUNTIME_DIR is present and
configured.

Note that we use su because on ubuntu at least pam does not use regular
session setup when using sudo, even when you use sudo -i.

Depends-On: I836bf27c4cfdc449628aa7641fb96a5489d5d4e7
Change-Id: I077c358a05ba39bcea756baa3d20f5007827d82c

'}]
commit_message:

This lib is what sets up the XDG_RUNTIME_DIR for new user logins.

Apt gets confused if it talks to a mirror with an older index than the
index currently cached by apt. This can happen when image builds use a
newer index than the booted image. Avoid these problems entirely by

commit_message:
Clean out apt index caches at end of image build

Apt gets confused if it talks to a mirror with an older index than the
index currently cached by apt. This can happen when image builds use a
newer index than the booted image. Avoid these problems entirely by
removing those index caches at the end of image building.

Change-Id: I4b77cc7d756665517dec6be3fe07280bb233104b

subject: Ensure we configure ssl.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-19 11:41:29.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/aodh/api.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/nova/api.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/nova/placement.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/panko/api.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/zaqar.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/gnocchi/api.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/keystone.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/ensure-ssl-conf-2f32c6ead6f3bb0e.yaml', 'manifests/profile/base/barbican/api.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/ceilometer/api.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/cinder/api.pp'], 'message': "Ensure we configure ssl.conf

Every time we call apache module regardless of using SSL we have to
configure mod_ssl from puppet-apache or we'll hit issue during package
update. File /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf from mod_ssl package contains
Listen 443 while apache::mod::ssl just configures SSL bits but does not
add Listen. If the apache::mod::ssl is not included the ssl.conf file is
removed and recreated during mod_ssl package update. This causes
conflict on port 443.

Change-Id: Ic5a0719f67d3795a9edca25284d1cf6f088073e8
Related-Bug: 1682448
Resolves: rhbz#1441977
(cherry picked from commit 9e729c0db22865d036860346eb6b81c4c2108719)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure we configure ssl.conf

Every time we call apache module regardless of using SSL we have to
configure mod_ssl from puppet-apache or we'll hit issue during package
update. File /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf from mod_ssl package contains
Listen 443 while apache::mod::ssl just configures SSL bits but does not
add Listen. If the apache::mod::ssl is not included the ssl.conf file is
removed and recreated during mod_ssl package update. This causes
conflict on port 443.

Change-Id: Ic5a0719f67d3795a9edca25284d1cf6f088073e8
Related-Bug: 1682448
Resolves: rhbz#1441977
(cherry picked from commit 9e729c0db22865d036860346eb6b81c4c2108719)
